smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onCreatePreferences appears to be too complex.
The function onOptionsItemSelected appears to be too complex.
The function useTransport appears to be too complex.
The function onActivityCreated appears to be too complex.
The function validateData appears to be too complex.
The function onOptionsItemSelected appears to be too complex.
The function getView appears to be too complex.
The function onActivityCreated appears to be too complex.
The function onActivityResult appears to be too complex.
The function selectItem appears to be too complex.
The function fromUri appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function onOptionsItemSelected is nested too deeply.
Function onClient is nested too deeply.
Function getView is nested too deeply.
Function onActivityResult is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'CredentialAdapter' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'CredentialFragment' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class CredentialFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: EmptyCatchBlock
smells.description: Empty block of code detected. As they serve no purpose they should be removed.

instances.message: This empty block of code can be removed.

smells.name: RethrowCaughtException
smells.description: Do not rethrow a caught exception of the same type.

instances.message: Do not rethrow a caught exception of the same type.
Do not rethrow a caught exception of the same type.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: InstanceOfCheckForException
smells.description: Instead of checking for a general exception type and checking for a specific exception type use multiple catch blocks.

Instead of checking for a general exception type and checking for a specific exception type use multiple catch blocks.
Instead of checking for a general exception type and checking for a specific exception type use multiple catch blocks.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionThrown
smells.description: Thrown exception is too generic. Prefer throwing project specific exceptions to handle error cases.

instances.message: RuntimeException is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.

smells.name: ConstructorParameterNaming
smells.description: Constructor parameter names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Constructor parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Constructor parameter names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: ObjectPropertyNaming
smells.description: Property names inside objects should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Private object property names should match the pattern: (_)?[A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (code == ConnectionResult.SUCCESS) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: code == ConnectionResult.SUCCESS
Parentheses in (preferenceManager.findPreference<ListPreference>("keyboardLayout")) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: preferenceManager.findPreference<ListPreference>("keyboardLayout")
Parentheses in (timestamp / 1000 / credential.period) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: timestamp / 1000 / credential.period
Parentheses in (timestamp / 1000 / 30) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: timestamp / 1000 / 30
Parentheses in (credential to code) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: credential to code

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.graphics.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.animation.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
kotlinx.coroutines.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: OptionalUnit
smells.description: Return type of 'Unit' is unnecessary and can be safely removed.

instances.message: The function useClient defines a return type of Unit. This is unnecessary and can safely be removed.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `it to if (!(it.touch || it.type == OathType.HOTP)) client.calculate(it, System.currentTimeMillis()) else null`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `timeStep * 1000 * credential.period to (timeStep + 1) * 1000 * credential.period`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `System.currentTimeMillis() to Long.MAX_VALUE`

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class CodeAdapterViewHolder defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
